intro: Neoschischkinia reuteri subsp. botelhoi, commonly known as the Botelho's neoschischkinia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and it produces small, yellowish flowers during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
